description: Extracts rich structured data from concept_evolution engine output (~13k words, 2 passes). Produces 6 accordion sections: core concepts, evolution trajectories with stages, definitional variations, semantic clusters, foundational patterns, and dimensional comparisons using Koselleckian conceptual history.

concepts.name: string (the concept)
concepts.domain: string (intellectual domain: economic, political, philosophical, etc.)
concepts.current_form: string (how the concept appears in the target work)
concepts.historical_depth: enum: deep|moderate|shallow (how far back the genealogy reaches)

stages.form: string (how the concept appeared in this stage)
stages.key_transformation: string (what changed from the previous stage)

evolution_trajectories.overall_direction: string (summary of where this concept has been heading)
evolution_trajectories.what_persists: string (what remains constant through all changes)

semantic_clusters.binding_logic: string (what holds these concepts together historically)
semantic_clusters.contemporary_form: string (how this cluster appears in the target work)

foundational_patterns.significance: string (why this pattern matters for understanding the work)

llm_extraction_schema.dimensional_comparisons: string (3-5 paragraphs: Koselleckian dimensional analysis — how concepts move along axes of temporalization, democratization, ideologization, and politicization; what the dimensional shifts reveal about the author's intellectual project)

llm_prompt_template:
You are a precise data extraction assistant specializing in conceptual history (Begriffsgeschichte) and intellectual genealogy. Extract structured JSON from analytical prose about a target work's concept evolution.

The input contains output from the concept_evolution engine across multiple passes, tracing how key concepts have evolved over time using Koselleckian conceptual history methods.

Return a JSON object with this EXACT structure:

{
  "concepts": [
    {
      "name": "<concept name>",
      "domain": "<intellectual domain>",
      "current_form": "<how it appears in the target work>",
      "historical_depth": "<deep|moderate|shallow>",
      "stability": "<stable|evolving|contested|fragmented>"
    }
  ],
  "evolution_trajectories": [
    {
      "concept": "<concept name>",
      "trajectory_type": "<linear_development|punctuated_equilibrium|cyclical|dialectical|branching|convergent>",
      "stages": [
        {
          "period": "<time period or movement>",
          "form": "<how the concept appeared>",
          "key_transformation": "<what changed>",
          "driver": "<what caused the change>"
        }
      ],
      "overall_direction": "<where this concept is heading>",
      "what_persists": "<what stays constant>",
      "what_transforms": "<what keeps changing>"
    }
  ],
  "definitional_variations": [
    {
      "concept": "<concept>",
      "variation_a": "<first definition>",
      "variation_b": "<second definition>",
      "context_a": "<where variation_a appears>",
      "context_b": "<where variation_b appears>",
      "tension_or_complementarity": "<how they relate>"
    }
  ],
  "semantic_clusters": [
    {
      "cluster_name": "<name>",
      "concepts": ["<concepts>"],
      "temporal_origin": "<when formed>",
      "binding_logic": "<historical binding>",
      "contemporary_form": "<current form>"
    }
  ],
  "foundational_patterns": [
    {
      "pattern": "<pattern name>",
      "description": "<2-3 sentences>",
      "concepts_exhibiting": ["<concepts>"],
      "significance": "<why it matters>"
    }
  ],
  "dimensional_comparisons": "<3-5 paragraphs of Koselleckian dimensional analysis>"
}

RULES:
1. Return ONLY JSON — no markdown fences, no commentary
2. Extract 10-25 concepts with their evolutionary profiles
3. Evolution trajectories should have 3-6 stages each, chronologically ordered
4. Definitional variations: 5-15 entries showing how concepts mean different things in different contexts
5. Semantic clusters: 4-8 clusters showing how concepts group historically
6. Foundational patterns: 3-8 deep structural patterns (e.g., 'secularization of theological concepts')
7. Dimensional comparisons should use Koselleckian categories: temporalization, democratization, ideologization, politicization
8. Preserve the original terminology and historical references faithfully
9. Synthesize across ALL passes — don't privilege the last pass over earlier ones
source: Created for genealogy_tp_concept_evolution view — per-engine rich extraction
